alert.note: Alert for Elko; Eureka; Lander; White Pine (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 29 at 5:34PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE AREA COULD BRING RISES IN CREEKS AND STREAMS THIS WEEKEND... Computer simulations continue to show an atmospheric river event will make its way into northern and central Nevada on Friday through Saturday evening. Snow levels during this time will rise between 6000 to 7000 plus feet depending on location. Surface temperatures will warm accordingly with high temperatures in the 40s and are expected to remain in the low 30s during the Friday overnight period. Rainfall forecasts at this time are showing slightly higher amounts of one to two inches of rain through early Sunday morning. Some small streams and creeks in Lander, Eureka, northwestern Nye and Elko counties could see rises as rainfall runs off and some of the snowpack melts. Some streams that could see higher flows include Lamoille Creek, Owyhee River near Gold Creek, Maggie Creek, Marys Creek, Rock Creek, Salmon Falls Creek, and Twin River near Round Mountain. Because of the potential for rises, it is advised to keep smaller children and pets away from cold and swift moving streams and rivers.
